title: Constructivist Learning Design and Learning Analytics for Strengthening Self-Directed Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic social science theories and LMS (Learning Management System) utilization experience
context.additional_context: Customized Online Course for Developing Social Competencies in Corporate Settings, Designed with Constructivist Activities Based on Learning Data-Driven Feedback

learning_goals: Learners can improve social problem-solving skills by 20% through constructivist tasks (discussions, collaborative projects) on the Moodle platform.
By utilizing learning analytics tools, learners can analyze individual participation patterns and develop and implement self-directed learning plans
Through formative assessments (weekly quizzes, peer evaluations, self-reflection journals), learners can continuously improve engagement and self-regulation abilities

resources: Digital Collaboration Tools (e.g., Padlet, Google Docs)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
